Stem: Often multi-stemmed. Flexible and willowy. Varies from reddish brown to blackish or purplish brown.
Leaves: Greyish-green scale leaves which cover stems and exude salt.
Flowers: Tiny pink flowers densely packed on a spike 1.5-7 cm long.
Habitat: Roadsides, riparian areas, coastal scrub, urban bushland.
DistinguishingFeatures: Smaller than Athel pine (*Tamarix aphylla*) and has longer and less dense flower clusters than Small flower tamarisk (*Tamarix parviflora*).
